revised_title: Fluids in Convergent Margins: Composition, Origin, and Role in Diagenesis
tldr: This article discusses the behavior and influence of fluids in subduction zones, focusing on their composition, origin, role in diagenesis, and importance for oceanic chemical fluxes. The authors analyze fluid-solid diagenetic and metamorphic reactions in convergent plate margins and explore internal and external fluid sources, including porosity reduction, diagenetic and metamorphic dehydration, and the breakdown of hydrous minerals.
